definition: Taishō, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1912-1926) of emperor Yoshihito 嘉仁[Jia1 ren2]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: I enjoy my tenure at Tai Ching Company.
sentences.chinese: 我十分喜歡在大正公司的工作。

definition: Shōwa, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1925-1989) of emperor Hirohito 裕仁[Yu4 ren2]
Meiji, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1868-1912) of the Meiji emperor
Yamato, an ancient Japanese province, a period of Japanese history, a place name, a surname etc/Daiwa, a Japanese place name, business name etc
Heisei, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1989-2019) of emperor Akihito 明仁[Ming2 ren2]
Akihito, personal name of the Heisei 平成[Ping2 cheng2] emperor of Japan (1933-), reigned 1989-2019
